work.p: This is a draft of lines from a poem first published as "After All, Not to Create Only" in 1871. The poem was ultimately titled "Song of the Exposition." This manuscript is a draft of lines 206-209 in the final version of the poem.

titleStmt.title: All Thine!
a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman

notesStmt.note: This manuscript was likely written in 1871 after Whitman accepted the invitation from the American Institute to compose and recite a poem at the opening of its fortieth Annual Exhibition in New York City. Whitman read the poem on September 7, 1871, and it was published soon after that in several newspapers and in a small book.

bibl.note: Transcribed from a digital image of the original manuscript taken by Brett Barney with a hand-held digital camera.

l.seg: To thee Thou binding Union ! all ! to thee! the
Dwelling & city & state — northern & southern — — item and
With joy this we ever dedicate
